hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
#!/bin/bash find data/ -exec rm -rf {} \;
# Managed Inputs aws s3 cp s3://avillach-73-bdcatalyst-etl/general/resources/Managed_Inputs.csv data/
### comment out the IFS statemeent and use the study ids array for testing only! IFS=$'\r\n' GLOBIGNORE='*' command eval 'studyids=($(cut -d , -f 1 data/Managed_Inputs.csv | grep -v Study\ Abbr | uniq))' #studyids=("genoa")
NPROC=$(nproc)
echo "#### Making directory structure ####"
mkdir data mkdir completed mkdir mappings mkdir hierarchies mkdir processing mkdir etl_logs
for studyid in ${studyids[@]}; do find data/* -type f -exec rm -rf {} \; aws s3 cp s3://avillach-73-bdcatalyst-etl/${studyid,,}/rawData/ data/ --recursive --quiet
java -jar jars/CollectIdentifiers.jar
mv completed/file_identifiers.csv completed/${studyid,,}_file_identifiers.csv
done
